titles.title: To require the Secretary of the Interior to determine the suitability and feasibility of establishing the Mission San Antonio de Padua in California and its surrounding historic and prehistoric archeological sites as a unit of the National Park System, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Natural Resources.
Referred to the Subcommittee on National Parks, Forests and Public Lands.

committee.name: House Natural Resources
committee.subcommittee: National Parks, Forests, and Public Lands

bill.summary: 1/5/1993--Introduced. Directs the Secretary of the Interior to: (1) conduct a study of the Mission San Antonio de Padua in California and its surrounding historic and prehistoric archaeological sites to determine its significance in illustrating and commemorating the role of pre-Columbian Indians, Franciscan Missionaries, post-mission Mexican ranchos, and pioneers of the western expansion in the development of the State of California; and (2) provide recommendations on the suitability and feasibility of establishing the area as a unit of the National Park System. Authorizes appropriations.
